momMetaData.momTitle: Managed Object Model for MML Authorization Function

enum.name: MMLAuthorizationMethodValue
enum.description: Lists the possible values for the MML authorization method.

enumMember.name: CPUSER
enumMember.description: The MML authorization method is based on CP user.

enumMember.name: COCA
enumMember.description: The MML authorization method is based on COCA groups.

class.name: MmlAuthorizationM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for MML Authorization Management function MOM. The function allows managing the MML authority of an OaM user for opening an MML session and give MML commands.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Not allowed in this system configuration : Modification of the attribute mmlAuthorizationMethod is not allowed in Multi-CP System.

attribute.name: mmlAuthorizationMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: mmlAuthorizationMethod
attribute.description:
Specifies the MML authorization method.
In Single-CP System it can be based either on CP user or on COCA groups. In Multi-CP System, it is based only on COCA groups.

attribute.name: ignoreCpSuperUserRole
attribute.description: Specifies whether the MML authority associated to role CpRole0 is ignored or not.

attribute.name: ignoreCpUserRoles
attribute.description: Specifies whether the MML authority associated to roles CpRole1..CpRole15 is ignored or not.

attribute.name: ignoreApSystemAdminRole
attribute.description: Specifies if the SystemAdministrator role does not provide permission to operate in Expert Mode. If true, the permission to operate in Expert Mode is only assigned using clusterExpertPermission attribute value in MmlSystemRole and MmlRole MOCs. If false, the permission to operate in Expert Mode is assigned either using clusterExpertPermission attribute value or by SystemAdministrator role.

class.name: MmlRole
class.description:
Represents an association between a role and an MML authority profile.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Wrong COCA-numbers value : In case of MML authorization method based on COCA groups and the specified COCA values are not integer in the ranges from 0..255. - Wrong number of characters in mmlProfile : This message appears when the MML authorization method is based on CP user and the size of attribute mmlProfile exceeds 16 characters. - Unreasonable value : This message appears either when the role name used as value for mmlRoleId attribute has been already used for any of MmlSystemRole MOs as value for mmlSystemRoleId attribute; or when one of the following role names is used as value for mmlRoleId attribute: CpRole0, SystemAdministrator, SystemSecurityAdministrator, SystemReadOnly, EricssonSupport.

attribute.name: mmlRoleId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: mmlProfile
attribute.description:
Specifies the MML authority profile.
This attribute value depends on system type (Single-CP System, Multi-CP System) and on MML authorization method hosted in the attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" in MOC "MmlAuthorizationM". If attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" is equal to CPUSER, in Single-CP System, the value of this attribute is a CP user identity, for ex. CPADM, created on CP via MML command IOUAL. If attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" is equal to COCA, the value of this attribute is a list of COCA groups in the range of 0..255, separated by a comma sign ','.To specify a range double dots can be used '..'. Example: 14,32..59,200..212, 25

attribute.name: clusterExpertPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to operate in Expert Mode.

attribute.name: cptPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to open CPT session.

class.name: MmlSystemRole
class.description: Represents an association between a AXE application defined role and an MML authority profile.

attribute.name: mmlSystemRoleId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is an AXE Application defined role.

attribute.name: clusterExpertPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to operate in Expert Mode.

attribute.name: cptPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to open CPT session.
